text: Dieter Krause (18 January 1936 – 23 August 2020) was a German sprint canoeist. He competed from the late 1950s to the mid-1960s. He won a gold medal in the K-1 4×500 m event at the 1960 Summer Olympics in Rome."1960 Summer Olympics – Rome, Italy – Canoeing" databaseOlympics.com (Retrieved on 6 December 2008) Krause also won four medals at the ICF Canoe Sprint World Championships. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Olympic gold medalists for East Germany Category:Canoeists
title: Dieter Krause
